fields.description:
I have a fork B of an original repository A.

I am in repo B and I want to merge the master of A into the master of B (to bring the changes done in the original repo A). While it cannot be seen the full name, the source is A and the destination is B in the screenshot I attach below.

The compare web page has at least 2 problems:

# The commit links (e.g., 507b2b9) should link to A repo (from were we are merging) and everything is correct in that link, except that it refers to the repo B! So link is broken. If I change B to A manually in that link, it works.
# When given the manual instructions, it says:

_To manually merge these changes into ssardina-research/A/master run the following commands:_

Then it says to add B as a remote (I guess to A), etc.. But this is not correct.

Hope it helps! (thanks for such a great service!)

!1153742204-Screenshot%20from%202018-08-14%2007-45-13.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wrong commit links and manual merge instructions at sync and compare page

fields.description:
This is a very annoying bug.  Here is what happens:

We have a master branch: "master".\\
I'm the UI Team Lead, so we have a feature branch: "UI/COOL-FEATURE"\\
I want to fix an issue in our cool feature, so I create a branch off the feature branch: "berry/REF-1234"

We have master-->UI/COOL-FEATURE-->berry/REF-1234.

I fix the issue: edit edit --> git add --> git commit --> git push

I go to make the pull request on the PR page: click on "Create Pull Request"\\
I get a pull request template with my recently-pushed commit and so on.  This is add fine, but the PR is set up to merge into master, NOT into UI/COOL-FEATURE.

I can manually change this, and then everything looks OK, but it's annoying to have to do this.  Can't your server know that branch "berry/REF-1234" was created off of "UI/COOL-FEATURE" and set up the PR properly?

Thanks for an otherwise pretty great product!
fields.summary: Pull requests always are against master unless manually switched.
Not able to login with my account

fields.description:
#Steps to Reproduce for SSH keys settings#

# Go to the *SSH keys* settings for your own account on the Bitbucket settings.
# Click the pencil icon to edit any SSH key.
# Click on *Cancel* to close the dialog box.
# Click on the pencil icon again.

#Steps to Reproduce for Branch Permissions settings#

# Go to the *Branch Permissions* settings on the repository's settings.
# Click the pencil icon to edit any Branch permissions.
# Click on *Cancel* to close the dialog box.
# Click on the pencil icon again.

#Expected Results#\\
The popup dialog will appear normally.

#Actual Results#\\
The popup dialog instantly closes itself.
fields.summary: After closing the edit SSH key or Branch permissions dialog box, the next attempt to edit it will instantly close the box.

fields.description:
h2. Description
I have a simple pipeline to publish my app with *exp* tools, but sometimes my login step ({{exp login -u $EXPO_NAME -p $EXPO_PWD}}) frozen and fail after a couple of hours.

Someone can help me ? Thx :-)

h2. Screen
!2635626087-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-13%20at%2014.32.42.png|thumbnail!

h2. bitbucket-pipelines.yml
{code:yml}
image: node:8

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        caches:
          - yarncache
        script:
          - yarn
          - yarn test
  branches:
    develop:
     - step:
         name: Publish to expo dev
         deployment: test
         caches:
           - yarncache
         script:
           - yarn
           - yarn global add exp
           - exp login -u $EXPO_NAME -p $EXPO_PWD
           - yarn run publish:dev
    master:
     - step:
         name: Publish to expo staging
         deployment: staging
         caches:
           - yarncache
         script:
           - yarn
           - yarn global add exp
           - exp login -u $EXPO_NAME -p $EXPO_PWD
           - yarn run publish:staging
definitions:
  caches:
    yarncache: /usr/local/share/.cache/yarn/v1
{code}
fields.summary: Pipeline frozen on exp login

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While creating a PR from Branch page on a Fork repository, the PR is getting the parent/main repo's default reviewer configuration instead of the Fork repo's default reviewer

###Steps to Reproduce

# Set up default reviewer on the parent/main repo
# Create a fork
# Set up different default reviewer on the fork repo
# Navigate to *Branch* page
# Click on any branch then create a new PR

###Expected Results\\
With the fork's repo name select at the beginning, it's expected that it's getting the "Default reviewer" from the Fork repo's

###Actual(Current) Results\\
The newly created PR is getting the "default reviewer" configuration from parent/main repo instead of the fork repo's configuration\\
!2408582562-ForkDefaultReviewer-size.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect default reviewer while creating a PR

https://bitbucket.org/castelazc/chimp/src/master/src/monkey/

But if I rename the repo to "monkey", and attempt to use the following URL, I get "Hmm..can't find that one" message.\\
https://bitbucket.org/castelazc/monkey/src/master/src/monkey/

The only difference in the URLs is the repo name.

This behavior seems a bit off nominal. :-)

Thanks

fields.description:
Follow-up feature request to [this question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Reviewing-a-pull-request-without-loading-in-one-page/qaq-p/841943]. Also, a [related question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Why-show-all-changes-in-a-Pull-Request-on-one-giant-page/qaq-p/596586].

*Issue:* Currently when reviewing a pull request in BB Cloud, all file diffs are loaded on one page. Occasionally pull requests have lengthy or numerous file additions which can make page loading difficult. Reviewing in this format involves much scrolling up and down the page, and is extremely inefficient for reviewers.

*Proposal:* Change the pull request format to the format of pull requests on BB Server, where a list of files appears in one frame and each file can be clicked on to view the diff.
fields.summary: Reviewing a pull request without loading all diffs on one page

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Page breaks when clicking "View source" from the commits' page then clicking the "Filter files".\\
Noticed that this only happens when the committed file(s) has a sub-folder.

This is specific to the flow of navigating to the source page from a specific commit.  When navigating through this flow, no default source is selected/passed to the source browser.

See attached files.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Pushed a commit in your repository with a sub-folder.
# Go to the commits page and find the specific commit hash
# Click the "View source" button on the right side
# Click "Filter files" text search on top.

h3. *Expected Results*
The page should filter and search.

h3. *Actual Results*
The page breaks with console errors.

h3. *Workaround*
Choose Master from the reference dropdown, or any other branch/tag.  You will then be able to use the search box as normal.

Alternatively, you can go directly to the source page for the specified repo, and by default master will be selected from the filter list.  You can then use the search box as normal.
fields.summary: Clicking the search box for filter files breaks the page when navigating from commit page. (BBCDEV-10633)

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

With the API v1.0 deprecation, there are some functionalities which are not available under APIv2 as it can be seen here: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/deprecation-notice-v1-apis/#a-name-deprecated-v1-api-a-deprecated-apis-and-2-0-alternatives

Is there any possibility to keep the following functionalities with APIv2?

GET /1.0/groups/<accountname>/\\
POST /1.0/groups/<accountname>/\\
PUT /1.0/groups/<accountname>/{group_name}/members/{user_name}\\
DELETE /1.0/groups/<accountname>/{group_name}/members/{user_name}

Thank you for your help,\\
Norbert
fields.summary: Functionality deprecations with APIv1 removal

fields.description:

That file or directory doesn’t exist. Go back to the previous page and try another one."

The commit log shows all the commits and the files are there when cloning the repo.

fields.description:
We have made a webhook to call our server when a push is done on a repo\\
The status of the hook is NET_ERR.\\
We got no error on our side on when we try with the same data from elsewhere we still got no error (on sender & receiver)\\
We send back a status 200 on call.
fields.summary: Webhook & Status NET_ERR

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
Pipelines YML file configuration with a branch inside curly braces is getting an API Post error when doing manual run.

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Create a commit with the following changes in *bitbucket-pipelines.yml* file. (note: push it in the same branch)

{code}
#!YAML
 branches:
    "{develop-test1}":
      - step:
          name: Clone
          script:
            - echo "Clone all the things!" 
{code}

# Push the changes then go to the commit's URL (E.g. https://bitbucket.org/username/repository_name/commits/3a33af5aec93fc01f042c3261bf6f5b44f98062b)
# Click "Run pipeline" on the right side to run it manually on Pipelines.

h3. *Expected Result*
Pipelines will run manually from the commit's page

h3. *Actual Result*
Pipelines didn't run and showed an API post error in the browser's console logs. (See screenshot attached)

h3. *Workaround*
Remove the "{}" curly braces, put only the branch name in your *bitbucket-pipelines.yml* file.
fields.summary: Pipelines branch with braces manual run API error

fields.description: It would be useful if we are able to set/add fixes version from a smart commit.

fields.description:
In our projects we have a number of tests and lints bound to pre-push hooks.

It seems that bitbucket server configuration was recently changed and now we get an error {{Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.}} in the middle of our test execution. The whole test execution process takes around 3 minutes.

Due to this problem we have to push with {{--no-verify}} every time.

We are currently on paid plan of bitbucket. Please assist.
fields.summary: Bitbucket closes connection during pre-push hook

fields.description:
I am attempting to use the link to a [custom web service feature|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/link-to-a-web-service-283641959.html] within a Bitbucket repo.

I have the Link Key as {{LK:(\w+)}} and the domain as {{https://externalservice.com/card/\1}}. So in theory that should pickup any part of the commit with a ticket number, which looks like {{LK:323042304}} or so.

It works for purely word related tickets but does not link ticket numbers with integers in them. Bitbucket tries to link to them as commit ids which of course brings up a 404 page as they are not valid commits.

I have placed some examples of what matches and what does not below:

Commit message: LK:694725259

Result link: https://bit_bucket_repo_url/commits/694725259

Expected link: https://externalservice.com/card/694725259

Commit message: LK:test3434

Result link: https://externalservice.com/card/test3434

Expected link: https://externalservice.com/card/test3434

An example repo with this bug is here: https://bitbucket.org/ShelterWeb/leankit-integration-test/commits/all
fields.summary: Commit linkifier takes precedence over other linkifiers

fields.description:
Pull-request will show 'Files changed (0)' (meaning no diffs available) when there are conflicts with target branch.

public example repository can be found [here|https://bitbucket.org/pure-apricot/test-binary-conflicts]: *git@bitbucket.org:pure-apricot/test-binary-conflicts.git*

Steps how repository was created:

# create 'master'-branch with a file in initial state (in my case: _application.apt_)
# create 'develop'-branch from 'master'
# change some lines in _application.apt_ file in 'develop'
# create 'feature/test'-branch from 'master'
# change same lines in _application.apt_ file in 'feature/test' (in order to get merge conflicts with 'develop')
# create pull-request targeting develop (should have unresolved conflict, file is not shown in 'DIFF' pane of pull request)

[Link to example pull request|https://bitbucket.org/pure-apricot/test-binary-conflicts/pull-requests/1].

Screenshot:

!2850710081-pr-conflicts-bug.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull request is not showing changed binary files when there are conflicts with target branch

fields.description:

Some customers preferred using their mobile devices to review their codes with the use of the Pull request page feature in Bitbucket.org.\\
However, the mobile view for the Pull request page using a mobile device (Samsung 7) isn't really viewable.

h3. *Expected results*
Pull request page is viewable on mobile devices

h3. *Actual results*
Pull request page isn't viewable correctly on mobile devices

h3. *Workaround*
Use desktop/laptop device as of the moment
fields.summary: (UI) Pull request mobile view for code review

Currently, the search functionality searches for Repositories which the current authenticated account has access to.

It would be great to have the ability to search for public repositories on Bitbucket Cloud through the Search functionality not limited to a specific account.

fields.description:
I got that idea, because I have trouble with my SSH keys. From my point of view, it's a bit strange that you can exactly see, when you added the SSH key, but you can't see, when you used the SSH key last time.

For me as European, I just can see that the key was used on August 8th 2018 02:00 for example.

The scenario I had was the following. I worked on one project and pushed several times my code. Then I created a new one, and at the new one I got an info about permission denied.

I know I had that scenario in a similar form several times as I pushed code and code and code, but I saw in my account settings that the key wasn't really used.
fields.summary: Better info, when SSH key was used last time.

fields.description:
Under https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests, you cannot go to a pull request directly unless it has an additional modifier.

For instance, a comment or an approval will display an icon which will link directly to the PR.  If your PR has no modifiers that would present an icon, you cannot link directly to it.
fields.summary: Under Pull Requests, you should be able to go to a PR directly.

fields.description:

fields.description:
With different reviewer on both main and fork repo, the PR's reviewer doesn't update while users switching between the destination repo.

fields.summary: Default reviewers does't update correctly after changing destination repo

fields.description:
When I view a pull request, it's kind of annoying when a line was changed and the diff tool flags everything in the line EXCEPT the spaces.

I uploaded a screenshot as an example.  Note how the 8 spaces in line 117 of the original match up with the 8 spaces on lines 121 and 122 of the new green code.  Literally NOTHING else matches.

!934464889-parallelmachines___eco-ui___Pull_request__710___REF-4037__profile_wizard_validation_%E2%80%94_Bitbucket.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Suggested improvement for diff tool when viewing pull request

fields.description:
We are using BitBucket 5.0 .1 with Jenkins 2.7.24. Our developer are having an intermittent issue. We are using "Parameterized Builds for Jenkins 3.2.1" we have Configure PR and Merge to trigger an jenkins build, but Sometime PR and merge request doesn't triggers the Jenkins build to run, but re-committing to the Pull Request might cause Jenkins build to run, other times a new Pull Request has to be created.

I have looked at the Bitbucket logs, but wasn't able to find anything, which can point the the root cause of the issue, since it happens intermittently, reproducing the same has become a huge issue.

Any help will be highly appreciable.\\
Thanks.
fields.summary: Pull Requests not always run a build in Jenkins

fields.description:
While pushing new files to your downloads page, if a file contains a character such as "\n" which means "new line", the Downloads page doesn't know what to do and shows a simple blank page, as if there was nothing in there.

Removing files which contain this character in their name fixes the issue.
fields.summary: New line character on file name breaks the "Downloads" page

fields.description:
It's best to include more information about build's artifacts such as the compressed artifact size and the upload status of the artifact.

As of now, there are no ways for users to identify whether the size of their artifacts is over the 1GB limit.\\
Hence, users would need to run command such as "du -sh <directory_name>" at the end of the build in order to confirm the size.
fields.summary: Include build's artifacts size and upload status in Build Teardown

fields.description:
While deploying with Code Deploy Add-On, if the file on the repository has special characters, it will error out with the following error.

*Error* : Unable to remove top level folder

Currently, be able to deploy with Code Deploy, please ensure files don't have special characters.
fields.summary: Code Deploy errors out with "Unable to remove top level folder" when there are files which contains special characters.

It says please resolve conflict but there are no conflicts\\
[Pull request|https://bitbucket.org/ALNT-DEV/atpm-vms-repo/pull-requests/373/renaming-the-indexscript_oracle-file-to/diff]

fields.summary: Not able to merge a pull request

fields.description:
A user who doesn't have write access to Dev, Master and Release branches still has the ability to write to the Build Status on pull requests for those branches. Users who inadvertently add an app with an Oauth consumer that inherits those permissions can break builds for the whole team.

What I would like to see is a way to block/remove certain integrations as an admin for my users. Not see or change the tokens themselves, just username and token name then allow or disallow it.
fields.summary: Improve permissions management for OAuth tokens
Pipelines - Cannot rerun a tag build twice

fields.description: Hello guys can you please revert the button color inside of pull requests back to blue, im thinking there is a merge conflict everytime i press it and it makes me very scared! :)
fields.summary: Yellow merge button

fields.description:
Dear Engineers,

Could you review customer's enhancement request for the branches view?

----
We are working heavily with branches and I need to compare more than only one branch against the base branch. Additionally, I want to bookmark not only the base branch, but my selection of branches as well.

I suggest

# using a multi selection widget for the selection of branches to compare against the base branch. Like for Labels or Tags in Jira.
# add these selected compare branches into the URL

----
Thank you,

Norbert
fields.summary: Enhancement of the branches view of BitBucket

fields.description:
It would be good to have the ability to enforce that all repositories created under the team account are private.

Currently, it is necessary to manually check it and, it is not possible to prevent a user from creating a public repository under the team account.
fields.summary: Ability to enforce that all repositories created are private(BBS-84648)

fields.description:
I am using bitbucket cloud. I do not know if this issue also applies to other hosting options.

h2. In a PR I expect to see a consolidated view of all of the commits applied to a branch, not the latest commit against the source branch.
In short, the same as if I did {{git diff target_branch my_branch -- file}} for each file per https://developer.atlassian.com/blog/2015/01/a-better-pull-request/. In my case this is not happening

h3. Only the latest commit to a pull request is shown. As such some commits / elements of some commits are masked.
Steps to reproduce :

# Create branch
# Create PR from branch
# Make additional commits (typically as a result of code review comments)
# Repeat step 3 a few times

h3. Outcome only the changes from the latest commit are visible. Changes from prior commits are masked giving a false impression of what is going to be merged.
Per the screen shots The branch was created, there was one commit and a PR was created. There have been 3 additional commits to the branch since then.

To highlight the point in the screenshots given.\\
The project/Libraries.scala file was added on the first commit and has not been amended since.\\
The sonar-project.properties file was amended on the every commit, however it only has diffs (shown through the UI) on commits 5885a17 and f197f08. It shows modified on commit eddc86a which happened between the previous two, but has no diff. (Note the commit ID's given are from the screenshot attached, any auto linking may be incorrect)

In a PR I expect to see the changes that would be made if I hit the merge button.

As an enhancement I'd like to see a selectible window of changes eg from commit 3 to present (for the situation where I reviewed just after the 3 commit and I do not want to re-review changes). I'd forgo this enhancement if it meant I could see all the changes
fields.summary: Pull Requests show only the latest diffs

fields.description:
Dear Bitbucket,\\
I am a really open-mind developer and really love this application but I have some problem with my account (I just created it a minutes before this mail).\\
And you can see the issues in the pictures below. I think that your system has lowercase my email account name (just guess).

Please take a look at this issue please, cause it is prevent me to login into this awesome application\\
Thanks and Best Regards
fields.summary: My account seem to be have problem to identify

fields.description:
When a new file is pushed to the repository, it is not accessible from the Source view. It will show "Hmm...can't find that one".

!4040616303-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

If you perform a hard refresh (clear cache) on the page, the issue is resolved. However, the issue will reccur on the next push.

Disabling the new source browser beta feature will solve this issue.

*Steps*

# Navigate to Bitbucket Settings and click Labs
# Look for the feature "New source browser experience"
# Disable the feature by clicking on the slider
# Browser your file once again and it should no longer show that error.
fields.summary: Unable to view newly pushed files with "New Source Browser" enabled

fields.description:
Hi there,

I'm assuming this is a replication/caching thing where there is a loadbalanced pool of webservers your end.

But, I found today after I deleted a repo, then recreated another with the same name. When I visited the repo and clicked a folder (that used to be a sub repo) I would sometimes see a blank white page, no bitbucket design at all.

This is my repo:\\
https://bitbucket.org/theroyalsdev/snkrbot-sneakerbot/src/master/

Not major, but thought i'd let you know.

ta,
fields.summary: Delete a repo, recreate with same name, see cached version

Hi. I created a shared repository named *grutest* in Feb 2018 as owner. Everything worked fine in Feb-Mar 2018 but after a gap of 3 months, I cannot see the repository at all, i.e. I can see my last commit in Mar 2018 but I can not see the repository itself.

Please help me find it. Thanks.

I am attaching a screenshot where you can see the commits made to the missing repository (grutest) under recent activity tab in the right pane.
fields.summary: Can't find my owned shared repository

!1887113558-prob%20im%202.jpg|thumbnail!

I tried many times to upload this, even i created a folder or a simple text file didnt work. But updating existing file works but why not the new added file or even a folder? How can i fix this, is something wrong in my process?
fields.summary: Files  commited but not exist in my  repository

fields.description:
The command "git ls-remote --tags --heads git@bitbucket.org:${username}/${repo}.git" is failing quite often as part of a Jenkins job. I ran the command manually four times back-to-back on the AWS EC2 instance and it failed twice and succeeded twice. When successful, it returns the information in less that 2 seconds. When it fails, it trys for 5-6 minutes, then returns

{code}
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Network is unreachable
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

This behavior seems to start yesterday and is worse today.
fields.summary: Intermittent failures reading from remote repository

Feedback on changes to merge button

I use Jira and Bitbucket and when creating a branch in Jira it sends you to Bitbucket and keeps you there which I don't mind so much as not being able to have an easy way back to Jira like an icon in the left sticky should I want.

Requesting a Jira shortcut on Bitbucket for connected accounts, likewise a Bitbucket short in Jira.
fields.summary: Jira to Bitbucket and back again

This is the account that doesn't work and the exact same project as above:

Would be nice to have link with number of open issues in the repository details panel,  like branches, watcher and forks, to give the visitor of repository a visual clue that there are open issues.\\
Regards.
fields.summary: Add number of issues wtih link to issues into the "Repository Details" panel

fields.description:
h3. *Summary:*
Some customer is asking for API usage endpoint so that they can monitor their API usage per account.

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/

h3. Problem Definition

Bitbucket users may sometimes exceed our API limits, however they have no way to see which endpoints are mostly used, unless they contact support.

It is also not possible for them to see how many requests they have left for the coming hour.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a way to users to see
(a) which API calls have been made by their user for a certain time frame
(b) how many calls are left before they hit our limit
fields.summary: API Usage endpoint

fields.description:
*Steps To Reproduce*

# Go to an empty master branch
# Change the branch to one with code available
# Go back to the empty master branch

*Current Result*\\
For some reason, after the steps above - some code are displayed in the master branch.

*Expected Result*\\
After the steps above - the master branch is still empty.
fields.summary: WRONG DATA IN MASTER BRANCH - Wrong content in Master after going changing the branch

fields.description:
When copying content that contents indentation into the Description box for creating a Pull request, the indentation will be lost.

For example, by copying the following paragraphs:

{code}
This paragraph is indented by 1 space.

   This paragraph is indented by 3 spaces.

      This paragraph is indented by 6 spaces.

{code}

Pasting it directly into the description box of in the create Pull request page will result in it appearing like this:

{code}
This paragraph is indented by 1 space.

This paragraph is indented by 3 spaces.

This paragraph is indented by 6 spaces.
{code}

Note: This doesn't happen with the description box in creating an issue.
fields.summary: Pasted content in Pull Requests loses indentation

fields.description:
When running a command which parses a String, it's necessary most of the time to use double quotes (""). If the contents of the string contain the "#" character, Pipelines will not recognise the character as a String and instead will comment the double quotes as well as the next commands until a new "#" character is found.

Check my build below for example:

!1004778473-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-03%20at%2010.05.54.png|thumbnail!

This should echo "###### This is a great test ######" but instead it prints a bunch of garbage, and prints my next commands with it, until the next "#" char, as stated before:!1460339220-Screen%20Shot%202018-08-03%20at%2010.05.37.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Double quotes are marked as comments when using the "#" symbol in a String on Pipelines

fields.description:
Unfortunately new bitbuckets ips 18.205.93.0-3 are blocked by Russain Goverment (this is result of telegram war). You can check this here https://blocklist.rkn.gov.ru

But 13.52.5.x are good. So can you configure geodns and return 13.52.5.x ips for russian?
fields.summary: New bitbuckets IP are blocked in Russia

fields.description:
Created a readme.md file with numberings but it was not able display properly. All the numberings were replaced by 1.

Here is the [link|https://bitbucket.org/fusioncharts/fusionmaps-npm/src/4c2edb96bd2a0a0a577af5425f8594ddc157f0fb/README.md%3Fat%3Dmaster] to the readme file.

Below are attached screenshots and readme.md file
fields.summary: Markdown file is not properly previewed

fields.description:
People have an option to approve or decline a review. Adding a third value 'reviewing' can be used by a reviewer to indicate towards a submitter that the person is currently doing the review.\\
For larger PR's, or if there is a large number of PR's then submitters may want to know if somebody is doing review, or a review has begun.\\
Secondly, if multiple reviewers has begun a review, and a merge is allowed, then it's good to know that more people are looking at the PR's and let them finish before doing the merge - perhaps while a PR is in review by at least one, then a merge should be blocked to allow for hte reviewer to finish his work (currently ongoing review is futile, if somebody else approves and merges before the other reviewers work is done).
fields.summary: Suggestion to indicate ongoing review

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
For the dashboard, the response time via browser's 'Network' details is a bit slow.\\
The average response time, as per testing, is around 5s to 9s with no specific time.

h3. *Expected Results*
Some users will expect the website should load or respond within of 2s.

h3. *Actual Results*
The website's average response time is around 5s to 9s.
fields.summary: Dashboard is slow to load, especially when there are many items

fields.description:
Currently, on a new repository, when a user adds pipelines config file (bitbucket-pipelines.yml) to another branch other than the main branch (main branch does not have a config file), a pipelines build will be triggered. However, when the user clicks the Pipelines tab on the navigation panel, the UI prompts you to create a bitbucket pipelines config file and asks you to commit in order to enable pipelines.

The reason for this is because pipelines checks on the main branch for the config file for the initial setup. However, it prompts to create a new pipelines configuration file.

_Steps to Reproduce_

# Create a new repository.
# Make a new commit of any file (master as the main branch)
# Create a new branch (develop)
# Enable pipelines by navigating to  to Repository Settings >> Pipelines >> Settings
# Commit a new bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and notice on the commit view you can see the build status
# Now click on the Pipelines tab on the navigation bar and you will be prompted to create a pipelines config file as it does not exist on the main branch

*Request*

It would be good to add a feature to detect pipelines config from from other branches as well during initial setup rather than checking only on the main branch.
fields.summary: Ability for pipelines to detect Yaml configuration file from branches other than main branch during initial setup

fields.description:
If we fork a repo (such as testFork repo) from the original repo (such as test repo), it's only available to create pull request from fork repo (testFork) to the original repo (test):

!3925740312-11.png|thumbnail!

And it's not available to create pull request from original repo (test) to fork repo (testFork).

And it will be covenient if bitbucket can support the feature to create pull request to merge changes from original repo to fork repo.
fields.summary: Enable to create pull request from original repo to fork repo
NPM Error: EACCES: permission denied

fields.description:
With the new beta feature of "New Source Browser Experience" enabled, files with .scala aren't syntax highlighted. They are being displayed in plain text.

Adding this "?spa=0&fileviewer=file-view-default" to the end of the URL will then show the file as highlighted.

*Source Browser enabled*\\
!2041485796-1.PNG|thumbnail!

*Source Browser Disabled*\\
!2267624686-2.PNG|thumbnail!

*Workaround* : To disable the New Source Browser Experience feature

# Navigate to Bitbucket Settings and click Labs
# Look for the feature "New source browser experience"
# Disable the feature
# Browser your file once again and the code should be syntax highlighted.
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting for Scala does not work when New Source browser beta feature enabled

fields.description:
I created 2 java files on the web interface by copy pasting code from my local chromebook. When I click on <>Source the files are listed. When I click Commits both the commits and their messages are listed. However when I click on the file hyperlink from the Source Pane to view its contents, I get this\\
Hmm... can't find that one\\
That file or directory doesn’t exist. Go back to the previous page and try another one.
fields.summary: Files created on web interface seem OK from Source and Commits panes, but refuse to show up when clicked

fields.description: I have a repository (FullMedical) that contains a folder (resources/views/reports) that does not appear on the web but does contain it when cloning it. Can you help me? It is quite annoying not to see my repository completely on the web
fields.summary: Folder is not showing on web

fields.description: As an user, mainly for migrations from other services, it would be great to have an API call for repository imports(https://bitbucket.org/repo/import). There is no API call currently available for this service on the https://developer.atlassian.com/ page.
fields.summary: Add a new API call for repository imports

fields.description:
*Expected Behavior*

A user is able to toggle the Omnibar from any page in Bitbucket. This is mentioned in the blog post "[6 Bitbucket Secrets|https://developer.atlassian.com/blog/2016/02/6-secret-bitbucket-features/]":

"Bitbucket's omnibar is a quick actions bar, similar to Jetbrains' ⇧⇧ or Sublime Text's ⌘+P. From any page, you can launch the omnibar by pressing the . key."

*Actual Behavior*

The Omnibar is not launched on the [Dashboard Overview|https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview] page when pressing the '.' key.
fields.summary: Period ('.') Shortcut Key Doesn't Toggle Omnibar on Dashboard Overview Page

fields.description: It appears as if I can't do {{/bitbucket}} commands any longer in one of the private channels I'm a part of. However the Bitbucket bot is still there in that channel. Moreover, I'm still able to direct message the bot and it responds to the {{/bitbucket}} commands in my personal thread. Do you have an idea of what's going on with the integration?
fields.summary: Slack integration for Bitbucket Cloud fails in channels

fields.description:
Have invited a new user to Bitbucket cloud, but user never receives invitation email to their work account.

We have managed to send invitation to their private account, but the work account invitation doesn't arrive. Removed invitation and re-added but no success. Have checked our mail proxy and it does not reach us, seems the invitation never leaves bitbucket.
fields.summary: User account invitation not arriving

fields.description:
Periodically, there is no access to BitBacket from the server's ubuntu.\\
The following message is displayed:!2918050156-111.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Periodically, there is no access to BitBacket from the server's ubuntu

fields.description:
I upload the content with Sourcetree and when I access the Bitbucket website, when I try to navigate through the repository, it does not find the folders.

In case it is an isolated case, this is my repository. https://bitbucket.org/js_code/full-s-library-ecmascript-6/src/master/
fields.summary: Can not find the folders

fields.description:
Hi

fatal: unable to access 'https://anatolyenin@bitbucket.org/ccidevelop/cci.git/': OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443

At me and my team since 31.07 the error in SourceTree began to arise. If anyone knows how to fix it.
fields.summary: OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443
